bibl.title: Letter from [William Crawford Gorgas] to N. M. Miller, November 26, 1915

div1.p: Gorgas informs Miller that a painting of Walter Reed has been approved and will be hung in the Walter Reed General Hospital. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from [William Crawford Gorgas] to N. M. Miller, November 26, 1915
div1.opener:
18. Nov. 26, 1915 N. M. Miller,
-------------------------------------------------
631 Penna Ave n.w. Washington, D.C.
Nov. 23, 1915 States that he has comple-
ted the portrait of Dr. Walter Reed,
and it has been viewed by Mrs Reed, and
her daughter and several others, and
all pronounce it very satisfactory etc
On Friday next I expect to deliver and
hang the portrait in the Walter Reed
G.H., where it will be a fine and last-
ing tribute to the memory of the great
benefactor; and I am proud and highly
pleased to have been able to succeed
in obtaining such a perfect likeness
of him. The price of the portrait as
I quoted before is $550. including the
frame, which Mrs Reed and I have alrea-
dy selected.
WG
Reed
18-refer 106127 128 for
payment.
N.
[unclear]
Form No. 128, S. G. O.
(Write nothing in this space.)
(Attach this end.)
My dear Mr. Miller:
div1.p:
Referring to your letter of the 23d instant announcing completion
of portrait of Major Walter Reed, I take pleasure in informing you that
the committee representing this office unanimously accept the portrait
and extend to you its congratulations upon the success of your efforts
in producing so satisfactory a likeness of the late Dr. Reed. When the
framed picture shall have been delivered at the Walter Reed General Hos-
pital you will please send me bill for the same at the price mentioned
in your letter.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully yours, [unclear] (Write nothing in this space.)
(Attach this end.)
18
MAW
November 26, 1915.
Mr. N. M. Miller,
641 Pennsylvania Ave., N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
